text.*:
A map of Africa with national flags, excluding dependent territories and partially recognized states

These are the various flags of Africa.

Contents

  • 1 Supernational and international flags
  • 2 National flags by region
    • 2.1 African Great Lakes
    • 2.2 Central Africa
    • 2.3 Horn of Africa
    • 2.4 Indian Ocean islands
    • 2.5 North Africa
    • 2.6 Southern Africa
    • 2.7 West Africa
  • 3 Subnational/territorial flags
  • 4 Historical flags
    • 4.1 Bantustans of South Africa
    • 4.2 Bantustans of South-West Africa
  • 5 See also

Historical flags[edit]

  • Flag of Biafra
    (1967–70)
  • Flag of Republic of Benin
    (1967)
  • Flag of Katanga
    (1960–63)
  • Flag of the Federation of Arab Republics
    (1972–1984)
    See also: List of Egyptian flags
  • Flag of the Federation of Rhodesia and Nyasaland
    (1953–63)
  • Flag of Rhodesia
    (1964–68)
  • Flag of Rhodesia
    (1968–79)
    See also: List of Rhodesian flags
  • Flag of the Rif Republic
    (1921–26)
  • Flag of South Africa
    (1928–1994)
    See also: List of South African flags
  • Flag of South Kasai
    (1960–1962)
  • Flag of Tanganyika
    (1961–1964)
  • Flag of the United Arab Republic
    (1958–1961)
    Syria left union in 1961 but Egypt retained name and flag until 1971
  • Flag of Zimbabwe Rhodesia
    (1979)
  • Flag of Zaire
    (1971–1997)
    See also: List of flags of the Democratic Republic of the Congo
  • Flag of the Sultanate of Zanzibar
    (1856–1963)
  • Flag of the Sultanate of Zanzibar
    (1963–1964)
  • First Flag of the People's Republic of Zanzibar and Pemba
    (1964)
  • Second Flag of the People's Republic of Zanzibar and Pemba
    (1964)
  • Flag of the Zuid-Afrikaansche Republiek
    (1852-1902)
  • Flag of the Oranje-Vrijstaat Republiek
    (1854-1902)
  • Flag of South Yemen
    (1967–1990)

Bantustans of South Africa[edit]

See also: Bantustan
  • Flag of Bophuthatswana
    (1973–1994)
  • Flag of Ciskei
    (1977–1994)
  • Flag of Gazankulu
    (1973–1994)
  • Flag of KwaNdebele
    (1982–1994)
  • Flag of KaNgwane
    (Used until 26 April 1994)
  • Flag of KwaZulu
    (1985–1994)
  • Flag of Lebowa
    (1974–1994)
  • Flag of QwaQwa
    (1975–1994)
  • Flag of Transkei
    (1966–1994)
  • Flag of Venda
    (1973–1994)

  • Flag of Bushmanland
    (1989)
  • Flag of Damaraland
    (1980–1989)
    (Unofficial)
  • Flag of East Caprivi
    (1977–1989)
  • Flag of Hereroland
    (1968–1989)
  • Flag of Kavangoland
    (1973–1989)
  • Flag of Namaland
    (1980–1989)
    (Unofficial)
  • Flag of Ovamboland
    (1973–1989)
  • Flag of Rehoboth
    (1979–1989)
    (Unofficial)
